title: ICE converting Box<[T]> to pointer

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
```rust
fn do_it() {
    let b1: Box<[usize]> = vec![1, 2, 3].into();
    // let p1 = b1.into_raw();
    let p1 = b1 as *const _;
}
```

([Playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=beta&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=a00a2afff111570a0bac76b59ab64849))

Errors:


On 1.47.0-nightly both conversion attempts give a normal error. On 1.46.0-beta.2 the top one gives a normal error, the bottom one gives this ICE. On my machine, both for 1.46.0-nightly (346aec9b0 2020-07-11) and 1.46.0-beta.2 (6f959902b 2020-07-23), the top one gives a normal error, the bottom one gives a slightly different ICE:

Before running `rustup upgrade`, on nightly also the top line gave a similar ICE, but now it doesn't, even though rustup said it didn't change anything...
